data.title: TmxLayer2D is refcounted, but TmxFile2D is working with it as raw ptrs

https://github.com/AtomicGameEngine/AtomicGameEngine/blob/master/Source/Atomic/Atomic2D/TmxFile2D.h#L216

It causing an engine crash on destructor.

```

     AtomicEditor.exe!Atomic::HashMap<Atomic::StringHash,Atomic::ResourceGroup>::~HashMap<Atomic::StringHash,Atomic::ResourceGroup>()Строка 244    C++
     AtomicEditor.exe!Atomic::ResourceCache::~ResourceCache()Строка 92    C++
     [Внешний код]    
     AtomicEditor.exe!Atomic::RefCounted::ReleaseRef()Строка 72    C++
     AtomicEditor.exe!Atomic::SharedPtr<Atomic::Object>::ReleaseRef()Строка 191    C++
     AtomicEditor.exe!Atomic::SharedPtr<Atomic::Object>::~SharedPtr<Atomic::Object>()Строка 60    C++
     [Внешний код]

```

data.title: Profiler should include memory information
data.body: A breakdown of memory usage would be very helpful. Main mem vs GFX Mem, amount of memory used by resource classes such as textures, models, audio, etc.

data.title: CMake_VS2015.bat should generate a project for editor .ts sources
data.body: VS2015 supports typescript in web projects, it would be good to have the CMake project generate one to be able to work on the typescript directly in the Atomic solution

data.title: libcurl CMake configuration
data.body: Currently the libcurl in ThirdParty runs a slew of configuration setup and generates configuration headers when configuring the build via CMake.   This takes a lot of time, is fragile, and shouldn't be necessary as we should be able to specify the config for the platforms supported as with other third party dependencies.

data.title: Expand settings setting to consistently handle defaults, commandline arguments and precedence
data.body:
There are multiple separate implementations of setting default values for config and reading them from file. Setting precedence is also a bit brittle based on how/where settings are loaded and commandline arguments processed. 
Ideally this should be handled in one place (a set of objects like EngineConfig) that implements defaults, loading settings from file and parsing them from command arguments and then deciding which is to be used in case of conflicts.

data.title: Textures should have compression settings and be cached as compressed
data.body:
Currently textures are added to the project cache in the same format as the original, and loaded that way. So typical working formats like png and tga are loaded uncompressed. Ideally the following should happen:
1) Textures should be added to the project cache as a compressed format appropriate for the current target platform
2) The cache should support multiple target platforms, so that when switching between targets, or building for multiple targets a re-import of all resources is not required (this is a major shortfall of Unity's project cache)
3) Project platform settings should include preferred compression settings
4) Textures asset files should include optional per-platform overrides for texture compression settings
5) Editor controls for the above :)

data.title: Save preferences when editor and/or player window is maximized on secondary monitor (OSX)
data.body:
- Delete prefs
- Launch the editor
- Move editor to secondary monitor, maximize window
- Open a project
- Press play, move player to secondary monitor, and maximize window
- Close the player and the editor
- Launch the editor

Issue: The editor restarts on the primary monitor

(primary monitor is 2560x1440, secondary monitor is 1920x1080)

data.title: Add editor loading bar for time expensive tasks
data.body: Editor need a loading bar which will indicate the process of the current task, because editor can be frozen because of importing model(for example), in debug mode we can see a log messages in console, but in realese, user may think that editor has just frozen.

data.title: TypeScript syntax highlighting
data.body:
Support for .ts files being colored as .js files are.

This issue is not blocked, but it's probably a low priority until after https://github.com/AtomicGameEngine/AtomicGameEngine/pull/614 is merged.

data.title: [WIP] Typescript Compilation + Exploring editor extensions
data.body:
This PR is more of an experimental dive into trying to provide the ability to transpile TypeScript on save of a .ts file in the editor as well as playing with an editor extension type of architecture.  
**TypeScriptLanguageService.ts**
This shows two ways of handling typescript. Either a simple single file transpile, which is very fast, but will only catch blatant syntax issues, or a full compile which loads all the TS files in the project and runs through full type checking etc.  This second option runs pretty slowly, and maybe either that can only be done on request, or during the build process.

**Typescript.js**
this is a customized version of typescript.js that fixes a regex issue that duktape doesn't like.  The BuildCommon.js copies this file into the modules folder on build.

**Extension Services**
Basically what is happening is that there is ServiceLocator that extensions can register with.  When editor events occur, they notify the ServiceLocator that the event happened and the ServiceLocator delegates to anything registered for that event that can handle it.   Right now only the SaveResource method is hooked in, but this could be hooked into menu rendering, inspector creation, even filetype resource editors if it got robust enough.

Some thoughts behind this were that you could have a Resources/EditorExtensions folder that could dynamically be queried by the editor to register new extensions.  In this example, the TypeScript resource extension is manually loaded in.  Also, it might be better to somehow hook into the normal event subscription model to notify these extensions of changes.

Anyway, this is definitely a WIP and needs some discussion and iteration to make it better.

data.title: UI render to texture support
data.body: As per http://atomicgameengine.com/forum/#/discussion/182/atomic-development-thread

data.title: Import assets option in menu with keyboard shortcut
data.body:
There should have a proper option on the menu to import assets to add to the drag-and-drop approach, preferably top-level and with a standard shortcut like CTRL+I or something.
Some kind of reimport/force reimport assets is also needed and could be put as a submenu of this new Import option. ( #608 )
Create submenus for the assets and prompt input should they need proper configuration(optimizations of 3D models or scenes for an example) . scripts, sprites, models, fonts, etc...
A good font of inspiration would be godot Engine, also, an opensource game engine.

This is the submenu with the options for different kinds of assets in Godot. It has no keyboard shortcut and no way to assign one as of this time of writing. 
![godot example import](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1557903/12373206/e028caee-bc58-11e5-87c9-12b8db98b364.jpg)

This is an specific import option of a 3d scene. Godot uses collada or its own format.
![godot import options example](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1557903/12373207/e028f44c-bc58-11e5-9481-95fb82ae754f.jpg)

data.title: Center window if it's outside of desktop resolution
Fixing a couple lint warnings

Add Asset Database submenu to developer menu, including scan/force update
data.body: Add a couple options to the developer menu for Asset Database, a simple "scan" and a "force" which will reimport all cached assets... for debugging purposes.

data.title: "Reveal in Finder" should be something different depending on the platform
data.body:
Context menus on files in the editor have a menu item called "Reveal in Finder", which uses Finder on Mac, Explorer on Windows, and something else (Nautilus, GNOME Files, Dolphin, Thunar, etc.) on Linux (I haven't checked if it works on Linux).

I think a generic "Reveal in File Manager" could be used for Linux if a name can't be retrieved somehow (like if `xdg-mime query default inode/directory` doesn't work because xdg-utils isn't installed), but Windows certainly needs "Explorer" instead of "Finder".

data.title: [Editor] Add support for list/array attributes and nested object attributes on components
data.body:
Ability to have the inspector automatically display nested objects and lists of objects.  This is to allow us to expose more complex settings to the editor without using external json files.
Components should ideally be able to have attributes that are arrays or lists of a given type. Ideally support lists/arrays of nested types.

data.title: Creating a static model component on a node does not allow setting of Submesh materials
data.body: There are 0 materials, so Submesh selection is empty and no way to set model material
